title: Fossil fuel rules catch Western towns between old economies and new green goals
description: The Biden administration is trying to dramatically change how and where oil and gas drilling occurs on federal land, which is getting mixed reviews in longtime drilling boom-towns.

title: T.J. Mack wants you to know it's OK to sit
description: Actor and comedian Brian Jordan Alvarez is a prolific poster online. Now, one of his latest videos has taken on a new life.

title: Muscogee Nation judge rules in favor of citizenship for slave descendants
description: Citizenship for freedmen, descendants of Black slaves once owned by tribal members, has been a difficult issue for tribes as the U.S. reckons with its history of racism.

title: An appeals court has blocked the redrawing of Louisiana's congressional map
description: A federal appeals court blocked the redrawing of Louisiana's congressional map after a lower court found the redistricting plan likely violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting Black voters' power.

title: The journey of 'seemingly ranch,' from meme to top of the Empire State Building
description: Heinz and Primal Kitchen are selling limited-edition bottles of "Seemingly Ranch" dressing. The Empire State Building lit up in red and white. It all started, as so many trends do, with Taylor Swift.

title: Gun violence doesn't discriminate: Quavo and others share their stories
description: Almost a year after rapper, Takeoff, of the music trio Migos, was shot and killed, Quavo, his band mate and uncle, travels to Washington, D.C. to discuss gun violence prevention.

title: Exposing the secretive company at the forefront of facial recognition technology
description: NYT reporter Kashmir Hill says Clearview AI has a database of billions of photos scraped from the internet, which it sells to governments and police departments. Her book is Your Face Belongs To Us.

title: Suit yourselves: The Senate formalizes a dress code just days after ditching it
description: Backlash ensued after Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer moved to relax its informal dress code last week. On Wednesday, lawmakers voted unanimously to codify business casual on the Senate floor.

title: Feds offer students new protections against programs that lead to high debt, low pay
description: The Biden administration is cracking down on for-profit college programs that don't adequately prepare graduates for gainful employment and leave them with unaffordable loans.

title: 250 million is the new 40: Mammals may already be halfway done on Earth, study finds
description: The future is always hard to predict, especially millions of years from now. But researchers found that a future supercontinent centered around the tropics may be tough for mammals to survive.

title: On Lampedusa, there's sympathy for migrants — as long as they don't stay
description: Some 12,000 migrants — more than twice the population of this island — arrived in a single week this month. Islanders showed compassion, but prefer that any newcomers leave as quickly as possible.

title: Michael Gambon, who played Dumbledore in 'Harry Potter,' dies at 82
description: Gambon was best known for playing Albus Dumbledore in most of the Harry Potter movies. The Irish-born actor got his start on stage and worked under Laurence Olivier.

title: Why India's warnings about Sikh separatism don't get much traction in the West
description: The current India-Canada crisis has exposed a sharp disconnect between India and the West on the issue of Sikh separatism. Michael Kugelman of the Wilson Center's South Asia Institute explains why.

title: Up First briefing: Biden impeachment inquiry; GOP debate takeaways; get more fiber
description: Republicans will hold their first impeachment inquiry hearing on Biden. Six takeaways from the second GOP debate. How to add more fiber to your diet.

title: FTC Chair Lina Khan's lawsuit isn't about breaking up Amazon, for now
description: The FTC's Lina Khan speaks to NPR about the goals of the agency's monopoly lawsuit against Amazon and why she thinks the company unfairly treats sellers on its marketplace.

title: Biden is talking about democracy as he aims for a split-screen moment with the GOP
description: President Biden's latest speech on democracy comes the day after the Republican debate, as a government shutdown looms and as House Republicans hold an impeachment inquiry hearing.

title: How rumors and conspiracy theories got in the way of Maui's fire recovery
description: Some of the rumors and conspiracy theories were driven by the island's history, but others were pushed by social media influencers and foreign governments.

title: Japanese scientists race to create human eggs and sperm in the lab
description: Scientists in Japan are leaders in the development of new technology that could make sperm and eggs from practically any cell in the body. The results could transform human reproduction.

title: 6 takeaways from the second GOP debate
description: The second Republican debate wrapped up with seven candidates attempting to break away from the front-runner, former President Donald Trump, who was in Michigan instead of attending.

title: House Republicans will soon begin the first impeachment inquiry hearing into Biden
description: House Committee on Oversight and Accountability Chairman James Comer said the hearing will examine the value of an impeachment inquiry and evidence against President Biden.

title: Oh Bother! Winnie, poo and deforestation
description: Now that Winnie-the-Pooh is in the pubic domain, it's a free-for-all. In Winnie-the-Pooh: The Deforested Edition, the trees have are all gone. The book is by toilet paper company Who Gives A Crap.

title: A woman is suing McDonald's after being burned by hot coffee. It's not the first time
description: Mable Childress, 85, suffered burns after McDonald's coffee spilled on her in June. Her experience is similar to the famous case of Stella Liebeck, who also sued the fast-food giant.

title: Here's what House Republicans are alleging in their impeachment inquiry against Biden
description: House Republicans are claiming President Biden benefited from foreign business deals by his son, Hunter, but they have not yet shown direct evidence of that.

title: Next time you read a food nutrition label, pour one out for Burkey Belser
description: "When design works, it looks like it's always been there," the graphic designer behind the ubiquitous panel on food packaging said.

title: Hollywood actors to resume negotiations with studios next week as writers strike ends
description: With the Hollywood writers strike over, actors will now get a shot at cutting their own deal with studios and streaming services after SAG-AFTRA said negotiations would resume Monday.
